description: Hemlo Explorers Inc. engages in the exploration and development of mineral properties in Canada. It explores for iron, gold, zinc, and other deposits. The company holds a 100% interest in the North Limb project that includes 653 claim cells comprising approximately 8,000 hectares located to the northeast of Marathon, Ontario, as well as staked 985 mining claim cells. It also holds interests in the Hemlo West properties comprising 350 claims. In addition, the company holds a 100% interest in the Wire Lake project, which includes 251 claims covering approximately 4,047 hectares; the Black Raven property, which comprises 415 claim units covering approximately 6,640 hectares located in the northwest portion of the Hemlo Greenstone Belt; the Goodchild Lake property comprising 33 mining claim cells totaling approximately 400 hectares; and the Benton property that includes 31 mining claim cells totaling approximately 500 hectares. Further, it holds a 100% interest in the Belcher Islands iron project, which covers 23,042 hectares located on the Belcher Islands situated in Nunavut, Canada. Additionally, the company holds royalty interests in the Hawkins property. The company was formerly known as Canadian Orebodies Inc. and changed its name to Hemlo Explorers Inc. in May 2020. Hemlo Explorers Inc. was incorporated in 2008 and is headquartered in Toronto, Canada.
ceo: Mr. Brian Michael Howlett B.Comm., C.M.A., CPA, CMA
